title: Round Watchfaces
summary: New set of watch faces for Moto360 and lg Watches. Below is setup and bug fixes.
description: Requirements:1) Have Android Wear watch.2) Have Zooper Widget Pro.3) Wearable Widgets.NOT STAND Alone APP! If you have issues look in the description! Welcome to Round Watchefaces. This app is designed solely for the android watches. 2 choices at this time more on the way!Sadly with out any control of my own the widgets  sometimes don`t like to play nice with the devices there is a fix for this but you will have to email me because it cant be done without me working the issue myself.I HAVE BEEN ABLE TO FIX EVERY ISSUE WHEN ASKED TO FIX THE PROBLEM Bug Fix: go into Wearable Widget setttings, Select Round screen Setting and toggle screen sizing toggle "fix widget to the outside of screen" then turn off ignore screen cutouts and the watch faces should work on moto360. it seems to not be an issue on the Lg G Watch R.How to setup:1) Download the app 2) Open Wearable Widgets and go to settings and select use as watch fsce3) Create A New Widget 4) Scroll Down to Zooper Widget and Select Grid Size 4X3 5) Select The Widget You Want To Use6) In the zooper settings go to global preferences.7)Scroll down and select standby updates. (this will allow you to recieve time and other watch updates when phone screen is turned off)8) Back out until you are in wearable widgets again and go to wearable widget settings.9) Go to wear watch face settings and turn off show notification underlay if you are using moto360 black or pipdroid.10) On your watch long press on your current watch face and then scroll until you find the widget you chose. 11)enjoy
descriptionHTML:
Requirements:
1) Have Android Wear watch.
2) Have Zooper Widget Pro.
3) Wearable Widgets.

NOT STAND Alone APP! If you have issues look in the description!


Welcome to Round Watchefaces. This app is designed solely for the android watches. 2 choices at this time more on the way!

Sadly with out any control of my own the widgets sometimes don`t like to play nice with the devices there is a fix for this but you will have to email me because it cant be done without me working the issue myself.

I HAVE BEEN ABLE TO FIX EVERY ISSUE WHEN ASKED TO FIX THE PROBLEM

Bug Fix: go into Wearable Widget setttings, Select Round screen Setting and toggle screen sizing
toggle "fix widget to the outside of screen" then turn off ignore screen cutouts and the watch faces should work on moto360. it seems to not be an issue on the Lg G Watch R.

How to setup:
1) Download the app
2) Open Wearable Widgets and go to settings and select use as watch fsce
3) Create A New Widget
4) Scroll Down to Zooper Widget and Select Grid Size 4X3
5) Select The Widget You Want To Use
6) In the zooper settings go to global preferences.
7)Scroll down and select standby updates. (this will allow you to recieve time and other watch updates when phone screen is turned off)
8) Back out until you are in wearable widgets again and go to wearable widget settings.
9) Go to wear watch face settings and turn off show notification underlay if you are using moto360 black or pipdroid.
10) On your watch long press on your current watch face and then scroll until you find the widget you chose.
11)enjoy
comments: It fits well The design I thought was basic at first. But after a day using it I love it. It isn't over done
recentChanges: Added the new PipDroid4000 watch face into the collection of watch faces to choose from many more on the way!
